```{r setup, include=FALSE}
knitr::opts_chunk$set(echo = TRUE)

library(readxl)
```

## R Markdown

Great resource for dataset: <https://www.eia.gov/electricity/wholesale/>

```{r Dataset}
electricity_dataset <- read_excel("electricity-2024.xlsx")
electricity_dataset

head(electricity_dataset)
```

2014 Dataset

```{r 2014}
data_2014 <- read_excel ("./Data/ice_electric-2014final.xls")
data_2014
summary(data_2014)
```

2015 Dataset

```{r 2015}

data_2015 <- read_excel ("./Data/ice_electric-2015final.xls")
data_2015
summary(data_2015)
head(data_2015)


```

## Including Plots

You can also embed plots, for example:

```{r pressure, echo=FALSE}
plot(pressure)
```

Note that the `echo = FALSE` parameter was added to the code chunk to prevent printing of the R code that generated the plot.
